Michael Clarke Duncan, who was nominated for an Oscar for his role in "The Green Mile," died at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles where he was being treated for a heart attack.

The Stitching Studio in Lowell is a two-year-old program that teaches professional sewing skills to legal refugees and immigrants.

Insurer accused of holding dividends

MassMutual is fighting several lawsuits accusing the insurer of shorting policyholders on dividends and preventing many of them from voting for directors.

Legitimate political figures have fed the notion that this White House not only isn’t great at creating jobs, but is actually un-American and illegitimate.

Sunny summer for Cape businesses

Cape Cod business owners said balmy temperatures and clear skies had driven soaring sales, both during the holiday weekend and throughout the summer.

Jeweler pays back wages after inquiry

Shreve, Crump & Low has agreed to pay 12 employees about $15,000 in back wages following a federal investigation into the jeweler’s pay practices.
